pullRequest.title: Issue #1646 Export node monitoring reports as Excel
pullRequest.bodyText:
This PR is related to issue #1646
It allows exporting instance utilization reports in the XLS format.

commit.message: Issue #1646 Implement export of node monitoring stats to Excel file
Issue #1646 Configure path to XLS template via env var
Issue #1646 Use formulas with relative links to cells instead of absolute values on the disks summary list
Issue #1646 Minor refactoring: reuse methods, use constants instead of plain values/literals
Issue #1646 Synchronize access to XLS report compilation method, open template in read-only mode

nodes.bodyText: Let's set the environment variable in deploy/contents/install/install-config to some default value.
Could we use approach similar to the one used in CloudFacadeImpl to determine what kind of writer is required?
I suppose we can get rid of checked exceptions being thrown from CsvMonitoringStatsWriter to simplify the call site.
I assume a proper error message would be nice in case templatePath is either blank or null.
Why is this method synchronized? It look likes we don't use any shared objects here.
Probably we can rename this test class to CsvMonitoringStatsWriterTest as long as it tests only the csv functionality.

commit.message: Issue #1646 Remove checked exception from `convertStatsToFile` signature

nodes.bodyText: Also could you please add the monitoring excel template file to the repo? And unpack it during api deployment in deploy/docker/cp-api-srv/init-api.

commit.message: Issue #1646 Extend MonitoringStatsWriters: return supported report type to allow searching suitable writer using (type, writer) mapping instead of the switch statement
Issue #1646 Code cleanup: use suitable name for a test class, remove method synchronization
Issue #1646 Check if XLS template path is empty
Issue #1646 Add XLS monitoring template: add the file to jar at build stage, unpack it during API initialization into the place, specified by env var

nodes.bodyText: I'm not exactly sure but the path in the jar seems to be BOOT-INF/classes/static/monitoring_report_template.xls. Could you please doublecheck it?

commit.message: Issue #1646 Fix template unpacking: change the target name, use the proper path

nodes.bodyText: Could you please initiate CP_API_MONITORING_XLS_TEMPLATE_PATH with the default value similarly to CP_API_SRV_STATIC_DIR?

commit.message: Issue #1646 Initiate CP_API_MONITORING_XLS_TEMPLATE_PATH with the default value

nodes.bodyText: It is better to keep CSV as default value to keep existing behaviour

I think that by default we can store the template in the api/src/main/resources/templates/ folder and use classpath:templates/... url as default value for monitoring.stats.export.xls.template. In this case you do not need any additional file manipulations during build and deploy and you still can replace xls template with some external value setting CP_API_MONITORING_XLS_TEMPLATE_PATH env var

commit.message: Issue #1646 Make `CSV` report type by default at server side
Issue #1646 Use requested report type as a response file extension
Issue #1646 Store template in resources and use its location as a default; revert excess changes in scripts
